intro: Knautia ressmannii, commonly known as the Balkan knautia, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and its stems are often hairy as well. Knautia ressmannii is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
